definition: fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing
sentence: The speaker's eloquent words moved the audience to tears.

definition: to attract the strong attention and interest of someone
sentence: The documentary was able to fascinate viewers with its stunning visuals.
The intricate design of the jewelry captivated everyone at the exhibition.

definition: a seemingly absurd or self-contradictory statement that may prove to be true
sentence: The paradox of choice can often lead to anxiety rather than satisfaction.

definition: the quality or fact of being able to grip something firmly; persistence
sentence: Her tenacity in pursuing her goals inspired everyone around her.

definition: to use flattery or coaxing in order to persuade someone to do something
sentence: He tried to wheedle his way out of doing chores.
The philosopher's theories are often considered abstruse.
The brobdingnagian statue dominated the city square.

definition: the fully shaded inner region of a shadow
sentence: The umbra of the eclipse created a surreal atmosphere.
The professor's lecture on quantum mechanics was so abstruse that many students left feeling confused.
